column1: Peasants were not allowed to hunt on the lord's land.
Punishment for killing a deer was sometimes death.
Sometimes doctors would bleed people by putting leeches on their skin.
People mostly drank ale or wine since water was bad and would make them sick.
Marriages were often arranged, especially for nobles.
Most peasants wore plain clothing made from heavy wool to keep them warm during the winter.
The majority of people living during the Middle Ages lived in the country and worked as farmers.
The peasants grew crops such as barley, wheat, and oats.
Since people didn't have a way to keep their meat cold leftover meat was smoked or salted to preserve it.
The first universities began during the Middle Ages.
